description.narrative: The group will strengthen the local Gram Sabha to collectively manage existing natural resources and to initiate soil and water conservation practices that will improve soil in the fields and enable multicropping, as well as preserve well water. Over the past year, 17 farmers have been working with CASS to develop a water structure that will conserve water and allow them to grow enough food for their families for 9 months. In the past, because of a lack of technical and financial assistance, the bunds the villagers had built broke, and they have only been able to grow enough food to last six months. To make up for the gap, community members must work as day laborers, which exposes them to a variety of injustices and exploitation. The farmers and two CASS staff attended a workshop in Mozda in Gujarat on properly building the water harvesting structure with local materials. With funds from GGF, the group will incorporate up to 119 farmers from adjacent hamlets, develop a baseline survey in the project area, organize weekly meetings for the Bhadurlatwa villagers, create a samiti/collective, selecting a volunteer to coordinate the activities of the group and the village, build the nala bunds, and monitor and evaluate the project activities.
